document_data.name: St. Faelar's Cloisters
document_data.architecture: Rustic stone and log construction<ref name=EotSS-p97>
document_data.mainbody: '''St. Faelar's Cloisters''' was a monastery of [[Ilmater]] in [[Calimshan]], dedicated to [[St. Faelar]].<ref name=EotSS-p97/>
document_data.Location: St. Faelar's Cloisters rested near the headwaters of the [[Calim River]] in the south-central [[Marching Mountains]].<ref name=EotSS-map>
document_data.Structure: The encampment was a log and stone rustic structure that had space for at least a dozen occupants.<ref name=EotSS-p97/>
document_data.Activities: The [[monk]]s and [[ranger]]s of the Cloisters engaged in the training of escaped slaves, teaching them how to survive in the mountains, how to climb, ''etc''.<ref name=EotSS-p97/>
document_data.History: In the month of [[Kythorn]] in [[1370 DR]], the entire structure was burned to the ground in an act of arson attributed to [[Tara el Viilam|Tara of the Burning Mists]], though this was never conclusively proven. This act of terror left three of the monks dead and was initiated by a ''[[flaming sphere]]'' spell controlled by a laughing, cloaked assailant.<ref name=EotSS-p47/>
document_data.Inhabitants: The head priest of St. Faelar's in 1370 DR was Father [[Jamad]].<ref name=EotSS-p47/>
